smart_goals.description: Reduce blood glucose level from 250mg/dL to the target range of 80-130mg/dL within 3 months through proper insulin administration and blood sugar monitoring at least 4 times daily
Complete 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic exercise OR 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity aerobic activity per week, plus strength training exercises 2 days per week, starting immediately
Achieve and maintain target weight of 140 pounds within 6 months through combination of prescribed exercise routine and balanced nutrition plan
Maintain LDL cholesterol below 100mg/dL and HDL cholesterol at or above 40mg/dL through dietary management and regular medication compliance, checked quarterly

Follow balanced nutrition plan daily by consuming prescribed portions of fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats while limiting processed foods and sugary drinks, tracked through a food diary
Attend all scheduled doctor check-ups (at least quarterly) and maintain daily records of blood sugar levels, medication intake, and lifestyle modifications for review during appointments
Reduce blood glucose level from 250mg/dL to target range of 80-130mg/dL within 3 months through regular insulin medication, blood sugar monitoring, and dietary management
Complete 150 minutes of moderate-intensity aerobic exercise OR 75 minutes of vigorous-intensity aerobic activity per week, plus strength training exercises twice weekly
Achieve and maintain target weight of 140 pounds through balanced nutrition plan including fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins while limiting processed foods
Maintain blood pressure at 120/80mmHg through regular monitoring and lifestyle modifications, checking at least twice weekly
Achieve cholesterol targets (LDL <100mg/dL, HDL â‰¥40mg/dL) within 6 months through diet management and regular exercise
Monitor blood sugar levels at least 4 times daily and log results, adjusting insulin dosage as prescribed by doctor
Attend all scheduled doctor check-ups (typically every 3 months) for comprehensive diabetes management and maintain a sleep schedule of 7-8 hours per night
